body_content.explanation: an older person, especially one with a respected position in society:
examples: You should listen to the advice of your elders.
She is my elder by three years (= three years older than I am).

body_content.explanation: an official of a religious group:
examples: One of the church elders visited her in hospital.

body_content.explanation: a small tree or bush on which elderflowers and elderberries grow:
examples: The sweetly scented, creamy-white flowers of the elder appear in abundance at the beginning of summer.
Hawthorn and blackthorn buds are bursting and elder trees are coming into leaf.

body_content.explanation: a sister/brother/son/daughter who is older than the other sister(s), brother(s), etc.:
examples: Her parents and elder sister stayed behind in Poland when she came to America.

body_content.explanation: the older person of two people:
examples: Of the two brothers Harvey is the elder.
He was the elder by five years.

body_content.explanation: used after someone's name to show that they are the older of two people who have the same name, especially a father and son:
